Posts.Title: Triple Negative IDC and radiation? kenziezmommie thenewme

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2009 07:53AM kenziezmommie wrote: Thanks 4 the info, thenewme!  They did not offer my mom the expanders as of yet, and I think it has something to do with her weight.  She weighs 92 lbs soaking wet, and that is her norm.  They are quite concerned about her getting through the chemo.  Dr. said she needed to start packing on more weight.  Also, during the lumpectomy, the surgeon took about 3 cm of the tumor, but couldn't get to the rest because it had already started going through the chest wall.  He removed the rest during the mastectomy.  I will try to get better path specs for you the next time I talk to her tonight.  It is good to know that reconstruction is doable after radiation.  Her Dr.s are telling her it is probably not going to be possible due to the scarring and burning caused by the rads.
Posts.Title: Triple Negative IDC and radiation? kenziezmommie thenewme

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2009 03:55PM kenziezmommie wrote: Thanx Raye! Her tumor was >5 cm, and that is why they say she needs rads.  As far as vascular involvement, she didn't mention it, but I will ask her.  I have read in many different places that the trip neg responds very well to chemo, and that is wonderful news.  My hope is that after the chemo they will tell her she won't need the rads.  Thank you for the great info and support!  It is nice to know that there is support out there for the ones involved that don't have the cancer.  I know we don't go through the disease and treatment, but it is mentally and emotionally draining on family and friends of the patients also!  Thanks again, and best wishes to you also.
Posts.Title: Triple Negative IDC and radiation? kenziezmommie thenewme
